wikipedia_page.main: Una May Cameron (6 May 1904 – 15 October 1987) was a Scottish mountain climber  known for her ascents in the Alps, Caucasus and Africa.

response: * Una Cameron (1904–1987) UK, ascents in Alps, Caucasus and Africa

In the early 1930s there were several visits to the moorlands around Mt Kenya, with fewer as far as the peaks. Raymond Hook and Humphrey Slade ascended to map the mountain, and stocked several of the streams with trout. By 1938 there had been several more ascents of Nelion. In February Miss Carol W. Carroll and Mtu Muthara became the first woman and African respectively to ascend Nelion, in an expedition with Noel Symington, author of The Night Climbers of Cambridge, and on 5 March Miss Una Cameron became the first woman to ascend Batian.
*1957: Una Cameron (1904–1987)Carol A. Osborne, 'Cameron, Una May (1904–1987)', in Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (Oxford University Press, 2004)
